SPCoreAudioController Class Reference

Inherits from NSObject
Conforms to SPSessionAudioDeliveryDelegate
Declared in SPCoreAudioController.h
SPCoreAudioController.m

Overview

Provides an audio pipeline from CocoaLibSpotify to the system’s audio output.

Tasks

Control

  • – clearAudioBuffers

    Completely empties all audio that’s buffered for playback.

Properties

  •   volume

    Returns the volume of audio playback, between 0.0 and 1.0.

         property
  •   audioOutputEnabled

    Whether audio output is enabled.

         property
  •   delegate

    Returns the receiver’s delegate.

         property

Other Methods

  • – session:shouldDeliverAudioFrames:ofCount:streamDescription:

    Called when audio data has been decompressed and should be pushed to the audio buffers.

Properties

audioOutputEnabled

Whether audio output is enabled.

@property (readwrite, nonatomic) BOOL audioOutputEnabled

Declared In

SPCoreAudioController.h

delegate

Returns the receiver’s delegate.

@property (readwrite, nonatomic, assign) __unsafe_unretained id<> delegate

Declared In

SPCoreAudioController.h

volume

Returns the volume of audio playback, between 0.0 and 1.0.

@property (readwrite, nonatomic) double volume

Discussion

This property only applies to audio played back through this class, not the system audio volume.

Declared In

SPCoreAudioController.h

Instance Methods

clearAudioBuffers

Completely empties all audio that’s buffered for playback.

- (void)clearAudioBuffers

Discussion

This should be called when you need cancel all pending audio in order to, for example, play a new track.

Declared In

SPCoreAudioController.h

session:shouldDeliverAudioFrames:ofCount:streamDescription:

Called when audio data has been decompressed and should be pushed to the audio buffers.

- (NSInteger)session:(id<SPSessionPlaybackProvider>)aSession shouldDeliverAudioFrames:(const void *)audioFrames ofCount:(NSInteger)frameCount streamDescription:(AudioStreamBasicDescription)audioDescription

Parameters

aSession

The session providing the audio data.

audioFrames

A buffer containing the audio data.

frameCount

The number of frames in the buffer.

audioDescription

An AudioStreamBasicDescription containing information about the audio format.

Return Value

Number of frames consumed. This value can be used to rate limit the output from the library if your output buffers are saturated. Delivery will be retried in about 100ms.

Discussion

See the SimplePlayback sample project for an example of how to implement audio playback.

Warning: Important: This function is called from an internal session thread – you need to have proper synchronization!

Warning: Important: If this method is called with a frameCount of 0, an “audio discontinuity” has occurred – for example, the user has seeked playback to another part of the track. You should clear audio buffers and prepare for new audio.

Warning: Important: This function must never block. If your output buffers are full you must return 0 to signal that the library should retry delivery in a short while.

Declared In

SPSession.h
